cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 3.11 openshift-enterprise-mysql-apb security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: openshift-enterprise-mysql-apb-v3.11.188-4 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11

reference.description: bz#1793299: CVE-2020-1708 openshift/mysql-apb: /etc/passwd is given incorrect privileges

remediation.description:
See the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for release 3.11.188, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata update:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/release_notes/ocp_3_11_release_notes.html

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Joseph LaMagna-Reiter (SPR Inc.) for reporting this issue.

note:
An update for openshift-enterprise-mysql-apb is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private cloud deployments.
Security Fix(es):
* openshift/mysql-apb: /etc/passwd is given incorrect privileges (CVE-2020-1708)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
